text:
FYI, the latest visitation report from Alan for Adrian and I is attached. We had an excellent time as always.
During our last visit, Adrian was really focused on making sure his room was ready here, as we had put it off in the past given our circumstances. We
spent about an hour and a half getting it set up, which wasn’t mentioned in the last report. The first thing he did when he arrived was run downstairs
to check if everything was still good to go, and it was.This is important to him.
Later, we looked through pictures on my phone since all the family photos had been removed from his house. I did this to show him that he comes
from
a place of love and ensure that we are all included in the pictures. We had a great time reminiscing, and Adrian enjoyed telling "his own stories" behind
the pictures. I texted him the slideshow so he could
keep those memories close and promised more.
Instead of our usual action movie, Adrian wanted to watch "IF," a childhood movie about a 12-year-old who keeps a picture of them and their parents
from better times. The story is about not losing a parent and honoring family memories. It was incredibly poignant and hit close to home.
Fortunately, the movie had a happy ending with the child reuniting with their dad. Talk about a tear-jerker.
Adrian's last two basketball games were tough, with emotional meltdowns. This time, I was able to spend time with him beforehand. He really
enjoyed
the game, was happy, laughing, and during the game, he came off the bench and said, "Nothing is wrong, Dad. I just wanted to tell you how much I
love you." For a 12-year-old boy, doing that in front of his team was a big deal to me. A WOW moment.
Sent:06/09/2024 at 02:52 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 06/09/2024 at 04:10 PM)
Subject:Re: OFW Communications
